text: Toosa batesi is a moth in the family Thyrididae. It was described by George Thomas Bethune-Baker in 1927. It is found in Cameroon. The wingspan is about 40 mm. Both wings are dark lustrous metallic green without any markings.Bethune-Baker, G. T. (1927). "Descriptions of new Heterocera from Africa and the East". Annals and Magazine of Natural History. (9) 20: 321–334. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1927 Category:Thyrididae
title: Toosa batesi
